intro: Polycnemum sclerospermum, commonly known as the hard-seeded nettle, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other members such as stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its small greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
